report.report_text:
[Report de-identified (Safe-harbor compliant) by De-ID v.6.22.07.0]
**INSTITUTION Consultation
Name: **NAME[AAA, BBB] Acct #: **ID-NUM MRN: **ID-NUM Admitted: **DATE[Feb 03 2007] Date: **DATE[Feb 04 2006] Dict: **NAME[XXX, WWW] Attend: **NAME[VVV, UUU]
Mr. **NAME[AAA] is a very pleasant **AGE[in 80s]-year-old white male who carries a diagnosis of end-stage kidney failure. He was admitted here yesterday after suffering a fall and fracturing his right hip and dislocating his prosthesis. The patient was due to undergo hemodialysis treatment yesterday, however, due to the above described events, that did not occur.
At the time of this consultation, Mr. **NAME[AAA] is in the process of receiving his hemodialysis treatment which he is tolerating well. He denies any complaints such as shortness of breath, chest pain, nausea, vomiting, or diarrhea.
PAST MEDICAL HISTORY: Significant for end-stage kidney failure. He undergoes dialysis treatment on Monday, Wednesday, and Friday and is under the care of Dr. **NAME[TTT] at **NAME[SSS] White Oak. History of abdominal aortic aneurysm with repair in the past, history of renal artery bypass, history of prostate cancer, history of right sided nephrectomy, status post right hip replacement, status post left arteriovenous fistula with occlusion in the past, history of vein stenoses.
MEDICATIONS: Include: Lipitor 10 mg daily, levothyroxine 25 mg daily, Lopressor 25 mg b.i.d., Nephrocaps 1 pill daily, Senna 2 pills daily.
SOCIAL AND FAMILY HISTORY: Noncontributory.
REVIEW OF SYMPTOMS: Significant for a fall.
PHYSICAL EXAMINATION: Mr. **NAME[AAA] is in no acute distress. Blood pressure is 158/74, temperature 35.8. Head is normocephalic, atraumatic. Neck is supple. There is no JVD. Chest: Symmetric expansion. Clear respiratory sounds. Heart: Regular rate without gallop. Abdomen is soft and nontender. Bowel activity is present. Extremities: No edema.
LABS: Sodium 143, potassium 4.3, chloride 104, CO2 22, BUN 60, creatinine 7.3, H and H 12 and 37.4.
IMPRESSION: 1. Status post fall with a right hip fracture. 2. End-stage kidney failure. The patient is receiving his treatment at the time of this consultation. Normally, he is on a Monday, Wednesday, Friday schedule. However, we will adjust the treatments to allow orthopedic procedure to occur without delay. Presently, his metabolic volume and blood pressure studies are normal. I will check his phosphorus level as he is presently on no binders.
We thank you very much for allowing us to participate in the care of Mr. **NAME[AAA]. We will follow him with you.
______________________________ **NAME[WWW XXX], MD
HS Job # 488164 / 36231 / SHY # **ID-NUM D: **DATE[Feb 04 2007] 10:26 T: **DATE[Feb 04 2007] 10:29
**CARBON-COPY
